text:
Bottle, shared @ Potjepalooza. 2016 bottle, caramel/brown with a short head.
aroma has a lot of bourbon, rye, caramel
taste has a huge sweet bourbon, vanille, a lot of alcohol, soft, oak, vanilla, dried fruits,
moderate bitter, smooth, full body, amazing. i really liked this one.
Bottle @ Potjepalooza, 10 cl sample. Slight hazy amber to copper color, short frothy head. Aroma of cookie, toffee and toast. Slight cookie and vanilla sweetness, toffee, bit oak. Lovely stuff.

Bottled. 10cl sample @ Potjepaloozas this-is-not-a-tickfest tickfest. The aroma has dried fruit, bourbon, caramel, hint of chocolate. Bit hazy, dark orange coloured beer with an off-white beige head. The taste is moderate sweet with vanilla, strong dried fruit. Full bodied beer with average carbonation. So nice.

Bottle shared at Potjepalooza. Hazy amber brown with a ring tan head. Aroma of oak barrel, malt, caramel, bourbon, dried fruits, caramel and toffee. Flavour is heavy sweet. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle, shared @ Potjepalooza, from an IP-trade with Patrickomatic. Hazy deep amber (to brown) color. Off white head, not much. Aromas: tofee, caramel, red fruit. Retronasal theres caramel, alcohol, tofee, sweetness. Flavor is sweet, caramel malty, a bit herbal. Long finish, sweet, somewhat alcoholic.

Shared from bottle at Potjepalooza. Murky brown with offwhite head. Sweet malts, caramel, spices, some cinnamon, alcoholic. Big sweet and moderate bitter. Firewater. Nice sweet smooth malty feel. Over medium body. Soft carbonation.

Bottle shared at Potjepalooza. Clear deep amber with small beige head. Loads of bourbon, vanilla, light spices, toffee, fudge, cinnamon, light chili. Just loads of bourbon and sweet malts with a boozy and rye kick. Very sweet and medium bitter. Full bodied. Really good.

Bottle at potje, thanks! Amber copper color. Aroma has whisky booze, spicey fruit, booze, vanilla and caramel fudge. Taste has vanilla, caramel fudge, spicey whisky booze, butter, raisin, ripe fruit and a boozy flavorful finish.

Bomber courtesy of IrishBoy (Thanks Richard!) poured a clear reddish brown with a small lingering tan head. Aromas of toffee, rye whiskey, caramel, oak, spice and dried fruit. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of toffee, rye whiskey, caramel, spice, light oak and a hint of vanilla with a smooth lingering toffee rye whiskey finish.

Bottle at Flying Saucer in Houston. Pours dark reddish brown. Beige head that dissipates quickly. Boozy nose with date and plum and raisin notes. Taste is very sweet, almost cloyingly so. Definitely a slow sipper. Nice, though, overall.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 ounce bottle into snifter; 2016 vintage bottled in 5/2016. Pours lightly hazy/cloudy medium ruby red/light copper color with a 1 finger foamy off white head with decent retention, that reduces to a ring of lacing eventually. Light spotty lacing on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining a thin cap. Aromas of big caramel, toffee, brown sugar, vanilla, toasted oak, spicy rye whiskey, coconut, brown bread, raisin, plum, fig, date, cherry, apricot, and apple; with light notes of milk chocolate, cocoa, fudge, almond, molasses, butterscotch, and yeast/oak earthiness. A fair amount of booze in the aromas as it warms. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/bready malt, rye whiskey barrel, and moderate fruity yeast notes; with great strength. Taste of huge caramel, toffee, brown sugar, vanilla, toasted oak, spicy rye whiskey, coconut, brown bread, raisin, plum, fig, date, cherry, apricot, and apple; with light notes of milk chocolate, cocoa, fudge, almond, molasses, butterscotch, and yeast/oak earthiness. Light-moderate rye whickey/oak spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of caramel, toffee, brown sugar, vanilla, toasted oak, spicy rye whiskey, coconut, brown bread, dark fruit, apricot, apple, light cocoa/fudge, and yeast/oak earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/bready malt, rye whiskey barrel, and moderate fruity yeast flavors; with a great malt and rye whiskey/oak spiciness balance; with zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light dryness from rye whiskey/oak spiciness, increasing through the glass. Light-medium carbonation and fairly full body; with a very smooth, creamy/silky, fairly tannic, and lightly slick/syrupy balanced mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is fairly well hidden; pleasantly warming, and not too boozy. Overall this is an outstanding barrel aged English barleywine! All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/bready malt, rye whiskey barrel, and moderate fruity yeast flavors; very smooth and dangerously easy to sip on for the huge ABV. Huge on the rye barrel presence, but still has impressive balance; and is not too tannic, drying, or boozy. A highly enjoyable offering.

Really nice barrel character here. I thought it might be lacking as its a single barrel, but damn what a barrel it is. Sweet vanilla chocolate and toffee, light spice and oak. Cant tell its 15% though its a sipper.

Bottle, split with jamesy. Huge, sweet, malt bomb with a lot of character and complexity. Its smoother than I remember Double DBA being, with a caramel sweetness that blends into an oak sweetness from the barrel. I got a strong vanilla flavor too, which was a great addition to the other sweet flavors. Really pleased to get a chance to try this one, and it lived up to the hype.

Amber color with a white head. Subdued dank malt-hop aroma. Dull sweet malt bomb with a bit of a bite; quite well balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tasted from bottle. Pours a dark brown with ruby tinge. Beige head that quickly fades. Huge bourbon aroma with some dark fruits of dates and plums. Taste is incredibly smooth with a sticky and chewy mouthfeel. Flavors of bourbon, toffee, caramel, vanilla, dates, raisins, nuts. Can't believe it's 15%. This baby is dangerously good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From bottle at tasting at Akkurat. Pours murky amber / copper color with a beigeish head. Aroma is big on bourbon, fudge, coconut and vanilla. Flavor is similar with big, bold fudge, coconut, vanilla, bourbon, light butterscotch with a slightly boozy, warming finish. Lovely stuff.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2016 22oz bottle from the brewery (I have great friends!).  Aromas of cherry, raisin, rye whiskey, caramel, toast, vanilla. Hazy red with a mostly lasting white head. Pretty sweet, boozy, cherry, caramel, toffee, rye whiskey. Full bodied. Delicious!

Appearance: cloudy amber color with beige head

Aroma: just wow! Coconut butterscotch vanilla toasted oak

Taste: Oozing with burnt caramel maltiness. Has those trademark Firestone Walker butterscotch barrel aged notes 

Overall: This has Sticker Monkee all over it. Not a huge amount of difference between this and DDBA

22, capped and foiled. Thanks, J! Another insane treat to savor. Pours a murky, near-opaque dark brown with a dense and creamy but thin tan film of head. No lacing to speak of. Big sweet nose, insane combination of intense caramel, toffee, butterscotch, vanilla, piercing alcohols kept just under control, and some peppery grain husk notes in the background. Creamy thick heavy body. Caramel, butterscotch, vanilla, heat, and a bit of pepper on the mid palate. Syrupy but still quite drinkable. Lovely beer for sure.

Sample from The 5th Element presentation with Jeffers Richardson @ Akkurat, Sep 27. Aroma of bourbon and fudge. Surprisingly light mouthfeel. Taste of fudge, bourbon, dried fruits, almonds, apricots, vanilla, browned butter, white pepper and warming alcohol. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at California Craft Beer Summit. Pours orange copper with a modest beige head and a magnificent vanilla and whiskey aroma. There is a full-bodied dark malt flavor with a lot of rye whiskey and a warm alcohol trail. A great sipper.

22oz bottle from share on 7/30/16. Excellent way to cap the evening. Darker amber with a small ring of beige head. sweetish aroma of caramels and toffee, butterscotch vanilla. More flavor follows capped off with some boozy warmth. Was expecting some rye sourness, but its rye barrel aging, so even better.

22oz bottle pours out amber topped with a small sand head. Nose is big barrel toffee caramel vanilla wow booze. Taste is more of the rye barrel wow this is so smooth toffee caramel sweetness spice vanilla barrel. This is amazing would have to say if it was 20 degrees out side instead of 100 it would be even better.

bottle, from Firestone Walker Store, good aroma, sweet, oak, bourbon, rye. cloudy brownish orange color, ok head, faded quickly to a ring, no lace, strong sweet flavor, heavy body, thick still creamy mouthfeel, sweet finish, darn nice beer, if you like barrel and sweet beers, which are good by me, flavor and mouthfeel best parts, IMO.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Dark clear brown color. Thin white head that quickly fades. Oak and molasses nose. Bitter front long sweet finish with a slight rye note. Very good

Bomber from the Firestone Walker Brewery Emporium. ($29.99, the most expensive FW Ive ever bought). Nose is rye (whiskey), lots of vanilla, sweet toffee, and a hint of cloves. Clear rusty brown with a medium beige head. Flavor is sweet vanilla toffee/caramel with light spiciness and peppery notes followed by a light alcohol warmth for the finish. Awesome!

Poured from bomber, split 4 ways into FW tasters...Im finishing up the rest after the Dubs lost to the Cavs. Dirty brown in color, just like DBA, with a minimal tan head. Nose is spicy, boozy, sweet. Somewhat of a balanced taste, sweet, bitter. Medium bodied with a somewhat oily texture. Good strong ale for sipping.

Bottle. Pours mostly clear copper. Aroma is vanilla, rye, oak, bourbon, caramel, bready malts, and some spice. Flavor is deliciously smooth with a huge malt profile with some caramel sweetness, spicy rye notes, booze, and lots barrel character. Medium body.
